summary: A walkthrough video where the narrator shares his experience installing OpenBSD on his desktop computer.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a gray t-shirt is seen sitting in a room with a desk and a computer monitor in the background. He is speaking and gesturing with his hands, occasionally pointing to the side. The room is well-lit with natural light coming through a window, and there are various objects on the desk, including a telephone and some books. The man appears to be explaining something, as he uses hand movements to emphasize his points. The camera then shifts to show the computer tower under the desk, which has a red light indicating it is powered on. The man continues to speak and gesture, occasionally pointing to the computer tower. The video maintains a consistent setting and atmosphere throughout, with the man as the central focus.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with one male speaker addressing the audience and stating that he will be sharing a video about minor aspects of his life because viewers want to see that sort of content. He mentions installing OpenBSD on a computer. Then, he shifts focus to a stool, reminiscing about using it as a child to brush his teeth, indicating the stool has been in his family for a long time.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a dark gray t-shirt, who appears to be in a room with a beige cabinet and a white telephone on top. He is seen gesturing with his hands while speaking, indicating he is explaining or discussing something. The room has a simple, functional atmosphere, with a white trash bin and wooden boards leaning against the wall in the background. The lighting is natural, coming from a window, which casts a soft glow on the scene. The man's facial expressions and hand movements suggest he is engaged in a conversation or presentation, possibly addressing the camera directly. The overall setting appears to be a casual, possibly home or office environment.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker talking about OpenBSD and his desktop, indicating he's had it for a while. He explains he doesn't use it much, preferring his ThinkPad. He then asks why he installed OpenBSD and what he's looking for from it, clarifying that viewers shouldn't expect many OpenBSD videos from him, but mentioning he might do some.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a dark t-shirt is seated in a room with a vintage telephone on a wooden cabinet and a white bucket beside him. He appears to be engaged in a conversation, gesturing with his hands and occasionally touching his face. The room has a simple, uncluttered atmosphere, with a wooden board leaning against the wall in the background. The man's expressions and gestures suggest he is explaining or discussing something with enthusiasm. The lighting in the room is natural, coming from a window out of frame, casting a soft glow on the scene. The video captures the man's animated conversation, with his facial expressions and hand movements adding emphasis to his words.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker stating that he "canceled internet at my house." He explains that he's unlikely to do anything fancy with something, mentioning he might just "toy around with it." He then clarifies that he installed OpenBSD partially as an "experimentation." The audio contains no music or background sounds.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a dark gray t-shirt is seated in a room with a vintage aesthetic. He is positioned in front of a beige filing cabinet, on top of which sits a cream-colored rotary phone with a coiled cord. To the right of the man, there is a white trash bin, and behind him, a wooden board leans against the wall. The man appears to be engaged in a conversation, as he gestures with his hands and occasionally looks to his left. The lighting in the room is natural, coming from a window out of frame, casting a soft glow on the scene. The man's facial expressions and hand movements suggest he is actively communicating, possibly explaining or discussing a topic. The overall atmosphere of the video is casual and conversational, with the man as the central focus against the backdrop of the room's vintage elements.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a male speaker who has been using Linux, and transitions to speak about using OpenBSD, suggesting that it is not "supposed to be that different". His tone is casual but critical as he complains about the direction of Linux and its distributions "screwing things up". He notes that OpenBSD people are "better minded" than many in the Linux community. Overall, the audio sounds like a monologue from someone who is familiar with technology and expressing their opinion.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a dark gray t-shirt, who appears to be speaking directly to the camera in a room with a vintage aesthetic. The background includes a beige cabinet with a rotary phone on top, a white trash bin, and wooden panels leaning against the wall. The man gestures with his hands as he talks, and the camera captures his expressions and movements. The scene transitions to a close-up of a computer screen displaying a command-line interface with text in English, including phrases like "Please return to OpenBSD" and "The bug report is being sent." The man is seen working on a computer, typing on a keyboard, and using a stylus on a graphics tablet. The video then returns to the man, who continues to speak and gesture, with the background now including a window with natural light and a toy robot on a shelf. The atmosphere is casual and informative, with the man likely explaining or demonstrating something related to the computer work shown earlier.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker discussing previous plans and then stating that he has decided to try OpenBSD for specific reasons. He mentions verifying that it's OpenBSD using a command, and notes that it might be backward for the listener. He then mentions that he will probably play around with it, and that he has only installed it. The speaker expresses frustration over having to sit on the floor, then the clip cuts off.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man with a bald head and a beard, wearing a gray t-shirt, seated in a black leather chair. He appears to be speaking directly to the camera, with his facial expressions and mouth movements indicating that he is engaged in a conversation or delivering a message. The background includes a white wall with a framed picture and a mirror reflecting part of the room, which contains a filing cabinet and a window. The setting suggests an office or a personal workspace. Throughout the video, the man maintains a consistent posture and expression, with slight variations in his facial expressions and mouth movements as he continues to speak. The lighting is bright and even, highlighting the man's features and the details of the room. The overall atmosphere is professional and focused, with the man appearing to be the central subject of the video.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a single male speaker describing his experience with a new operating system, noting that he's "basically done is install a couple programs" and realized that some commands he knows from Linux aren't on OpenBSD. He expresses a desire to make his scripts universal, considering POSIX compliance and avoiding GNU options. He mentions that some things will be "hard to live without" specific commands, highlighting differences between BSD and other systems.

events_list.audio_caption: A male speaker begins discussing the OpenBSD installation, specifically noting its command-line options. He explains that the installation involves an "install script" that presents yes/no questions.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man with a bald head and a beard is seated in a black leather chair, wearing a gray t-shirt. He is in an office setting, with a white wall and a mirror reflecting a filing cabinet in the background. The man is engaged in a conversation, using hand gestures to emphasize his points. He holds up a small object, possibly a ring, and points to it while speaking. The atmosphere is casual and professional, with the man appearing relaxed and focused on his discussion. The lighting is bright, highlighting the details of his facial expressions and the texture of the chair. The video captures the man's animated gestures and expressions as he communicates, creating a dynamic and engaging scene.
events_list.audio_caption: One male speaker begins by stating his dislike for something. He then expresses a preference for the Arch Linux way of installing things, explaining that in OpenBSD, while the actions are similar, the user isn't running the commands directly, but trusting a script. He shares how he had to learn that TTYs work differently and he is still learning basic things. The speaker then reiterates his preference for an installation process closer to that of Arch Linux, where the user runs the commands directly. Finally, he says "but I don't know" before the clip ends.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man with a bald head and a beard is seated in a black leather chair, wearing a gray t-shirt. events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with one male speaker expressing his confusion about OpenBSD, mentioning that the people who use it are "more tech savvy than Linux users", and that he would expect them to be capable of running certain commands. He also mentions that the historical installer doesn't give the desired options, but that it "installed very fine", and mentioning the firmware.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man with a bald head and a beard, wearing a gray t-shirt, seated in a black leather chair. He appears to be in an office setting, with a white wall and a mirror reflecting a filing cabinet in the background. Throughout the video, the man is engaged in a conversation, using hand gestures to emphasize his points. His facial expressions change as he speaks, indicating a dynamic and engaging discussion. The man's gestures and expressions suggest he is explaining or discussing a topic with enthusiasm and clarity.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker discussing the potential of an operating system on his laptop. He explains he didn't install it because OpenBSD, as far as he knows, is not compatible with EXT4 partitions, which he uses for Linux. He goes on to describe his usual file system preferences, mentioning NTFS for external drives. Concluding the audio, the speaker acknowledges he's rambling and expresses intent to try out the operating system and see how it goes.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man with a bald head and a beard, wearing a gray t-shirt, seated in a black leather chair. He appears to be in an office setting, with a white wall behind him and a framed document on the wall. The man is engaged in a conversation, as indicated by his facial expressions and slight movements of his head and mouth. The background includes a filing cabinet and a mirror reflecting part of the room. Throughout the video, the man maintains a relaxed posture, occasionally looking to his left and right, suggesting he is interacting with someone off-camera. The lighting is bright, and the overall atmosphere is casual and professional.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a single male speaker who begins by stating his opinion that he identifies with the way OpenBSD people look at things and how they've organized their operating system. He contrasts this with the stupidity of Linux. Despite this, he expresses contentment with his current Linux distribution, Artix, and its setup. He mentions this being the first time in years that he's bothered to try another operating system for himself. He occasionally tries operating systems out when helping others install Linux. He concludes by suggesting he thinks about his personal experience.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man seated in a black leather chair, wearing a gray t-shirt, in an office setting. The background includes a world map on the wall and a filing cabinet. The man appears to be engaged in a conversation, as indicated by his facial expressions and hand gestures. The camera angle shifts slightly, providing different perspectives of the man and the office environment. The atmosphere is professional, and the man seems to be discussing a topic with interest and enthusiasm.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a single male speaker who expresses apathy, saying "I don't really care about this stuff anymore, but I'm doing it anyway." He mentions creating a video in case someone cares, possibly because "people watch this channel" and expect "technology stuff." He concludes the clip by saying, "Okay, that's it. See you guys next time." His tone is conversational and somewhat self-deprecating.
